Package Main.BodyLogic

Class BodyPart

  • java.lang.Object
    • Main.BodyLogic.BodyPart
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GrievousWound, HumanLeg, HumanTorso
    public abstract class BodyPart
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • myPerson

        public Person myPerson
        This keeps track of the person this bodyPart is attached to. If the body part is cut off, it is equal to 'null'

      • bodyPartAttachedTo

        public BodyPart bodyPartAttachedTo
        This is the bodyPart this bodyPart is attached to.

      • attachedBodyParts

        public java.util.List<BodyPart> attachedBodyParts
        These are the bodyParts attacked to this bodyPart.

      • type

        public int type
        This is an index that signifies which type the body part it. 1-Organic 2-Cybernetic

      • bodyPartClass

        public java.lang.String bodyPartClass
        This is keeping track of the class of the bodyPart like 'arm', 'heart', 'skin', 'implant' and so on.

      • neededBlood

        public int neededBlood
        Amount of blood needed for the bodyPart to function.

      • bloodGeneration

        public int bloodGeneration
        Amount of blood this bodyPart generates per time unit.

      • neededEnergy

        public int neededEnergy
        Amount of energy needed for the bodyPart to function.

      • health

        public int health
        The health of the bodyPart. Determines how much damage the bodyPart can take before being destroyed.

      • regenRate

        public int regenRate
        The amount of health this bodyPart generates per amount of time.

      • regenLimit

        public int regenLimit
        The amount of health this bodyPart can regenerate from. If health is lower than this amount, it can usually not regenerate without help.

      • armour

        public int armour
        The armour or resilience of the bodyPart. A higher armour rating makes incoming hits less likely to deal full or any damage.

      • size

        public int size
        The size of the bodyPart. The bigger the size, the more likely a bodyPart is going to be hit compared to a smaller one.

      • organCapacity

        public int organCapacity
        This function calculates how many organs fit inside this bodyPart

    • Constructor Detail

      • BodyPart

        public BodyPart()

    • Method Detail

      • instantiateBodyPart

        public abstract void instantiateBodyPart​(int bias,
                                         int randomness)
        This is used to instantiate the bodyPart. It takes on the typical values of the bodyPart. These values are manipulated by the bias and a randomness.
        Parameters:
        bias - improves (if bias is positive) or worsens (if bias is negative) the stats and attribute of the body part. The bias is expressed as a present. So a bias of '10' would increase the bodyParts stats by 10%.
        randomness - changes the stats of the bodyPart by a random amount (both positive and negative). The greater the value, the stronger the random drift.

      • doDamage

        public abstract void doDamage​(int damage)
        This function will deal a certain amount of damage to a bodyPart.
        Parameters:
        damage - the amount of damage to be dealt to the bodyPart

      • attachTo

        public void attachTo​(BodyPart bodyPartToAttachTo)
        This function attaches this bodyPart to the given bodyPart and updates the new parents attachedBodyPart list and updates the myPerson.
        Parameters:
        bodyPartToAttachTo - the bodyPart this bodyPart should be attached to.

      • updatePersonWhenAttached

        public abstract void updatePersonWhenAttached()
        This function makes sure all the stats and attributes of the person this bodyPart is attached to, are updated according to the bodyParts own stats.

      • removeBodyPart

        public void removeBodyPart()
        This function removes this bodyPart from the person. All bodyParts attached to this bodyPart stay attached to this bodyPart and are removed from the person. The bodyPart is replaced with a grievous wound.

      • updatePersonWhenRemoved

        public abstract void updatePersonWhenRemoved()
        This function makes sure all the stats and attributes of the person this bodyPart is removed from, are updated according to the bodyParts own stats.

      • removeBodyPartFromBody

        public void removeBodyPartFromBody()
        This function travels recursively through all the attached bodyParts and removes them from the old Person.
